intro: Bupleurum muschleri, commonly known as the muschel root or muskroot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its root system is known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic effects.
